title: Moores Creek National Battlefield: Park Home
body: "King George and Broadswords!"   Loyalists were unaware of what they would encounter as they charged across a partially dismantled Moores Creek Bridge on February 27, 1776. Just beyond the bridge nearly 1,000 North Carolina patriots waited quietly with cannons and muskets poised to fire. This dramatic victory ended British rule in the colony forever.              The Battle of Moores Creek Bridge   Patriot militia firing muskets
